oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Inglewood Church of the Nazarene, 2001 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Inglewood Church of the Nazarene located at 3934 Gallatin Pike in Nashville, Tennessee. Historically the name of the road was Gallatin Road, but the location of the church has not changed. According to the cornerstone, the congregation was founded in 1941, and the church was built in 1947. The foundation is made of rough cut stone blocks. The exterior walls are made of rough cut stone blocks. The roof is gabled with tar shingles. The windows are small, square, and stained glass. The doors are made of wood with glass windows. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Inglewood Church of the Nazarene (Nashville, Tenn.)
